intro: Micromeria teydensis, commonly known as the Teyden's micromeria, is a small, flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a compact, low-growing habit. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Micromeria teydensis is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub habitats.
